text.text_translated: Religion (what people think about God) is important to Pi. His family is Hindu, but Pi is interested in other religions. He makes friends with a Christian priest (a man who works for the church) and a Muslim baker (a man who makes bread). Then Pi says something that surprises everyone. He says he is Hindu, Muslim, and Christian at the same time. His family and teachers ask him to choose one religion. But Pi does not want to choose. He says, "I just want to love God". After that, his family and teachers let him decide about religion for himself.
